v8:item.v8:content: High-performance mode is disabled. Standard mode is used instead. See the access restriction mode in the "Users and rights settings" panel.
First access update completed warning group
Standard access restriction mode is enabled until the first update is completed. See the "First access update completed" constant).
Number of access update threads tooltip1
Optimize for a database stored on a hard drive
A pause between job runs, or 100% updated.
The access update is queued (there are other background jobs in the queue).
Number of access update threads tooltip 2
Optimize for a database stored on a hard drive
The access update is denied. The "Access update at record level" scheduled job is disabled.
The access update is denied. The "Access update at record level" scheduled job is disabled.
The "Access update at record level" scheduled job is disabled.
The "Access update at record level" scheduled job is disabled.
The progress of access update for all lists.
The progress bar update is queued (there are other background jobs in the queue).
Calculate progress by amount of data
Calculate progress by amount of data

To calculate progress by the number of data items and access keys (low performance), select the check box.
To calculate progress by the number of processed lists, clear the check box.
Customize progress view for individual lists.
A name of a list of documents, catalog items, register records, or similar items.
Validation and update of access keys to objects and register record groups.
Validation and update of "allowed" property of access keys for users, external users, and access groups.
The total number of objects or register record groups.
The number of processed objects or register record groups.
The time elapsed since the completion of the last access update job for the list.
Optimize for a database stored on a hard drive
Update an object or schedule update of access to the selected lists.
Refresh the progress bar of the access update.
Enable the "Access update at record level" scheduled job.
Run the access update now and proceed until it is completed or canceled.
Stop and deny access update, and disable the "Access update at record level" scheduled job.
Allow access update and enable the "Access update at record level" scheduled job.
